Detailed Description

Distance cache. It may be used by split algorithms to avoid unnecessary distance computations.

This class implements a sparse matrix, storing only the left side of the matrix. Because of that, it will allocate only positions rather than positions required by a standard matrix.

Author:
Fabio Jun Takada Chino (chino@icmc.usp.br)

Marcos Rodrigues Vieira (mrvieira@icmc.usp.br)

Definition at line 114 of file stStructUtils.h.

References stDistance.

void stDistanceCache::SetDistance (  int  i,
int  j,
stDistance  d
)  [inline]
 

Sets the distance between objects i and j.

It is possible to set all positions of the matrix. However, due to optimization issues, it is not required to set the distances when:

  • i == j [always 0]
  • (j, i) if you set (i, j) [reflexive].

Parameters:
i Object i.
j Object j.
d The distance to be set.
